page.title: 12The River Tas
page.content: The River Tas is a small stream which has a valley much noted for its beauty and as a home for wild-life. The 16 miles of the river are very popular for all kinds of leisure and relaxation. There used to be otters but they, along with other species, have sadly died out. There are some public paths where you can fish, birdwatch and admire the beauties of the countryside. Some of the banks are privately owned. Along the side of the bank there is the site of a Roman slaughter house, where you can hunt for pottery, animal bones and other Roman relics.
